Question_English: What causes menstrual cramps?
Question_RomanUrdu: Period ke dard ka sabab kya hota hai?
Short_Answer_English: Menstrual cramps happen when the uterus tightens to shed its lining. Mild pain is normal, but severe pain may need a doctors advice.
Detailed_Answer_English: Menstrual cramps occur because of natural contractions in the uterus, caused by hormones called prostaglandins. These help remove the lining during menstruation. If pain is very strong or affects daily activities, it may be linked to conditions like endometriosis or fibroids. In such cases, medical consultation is recommended.
Source: Umeeda KB: Reproductive Health
Helpline: 1166 (MoH Helpline)

Question_English: What should I do if my period pain is too strong?
Question_RomanUrdu: Agar period ka dard bohat ziada ho to kya karun?
Short_Answer_English: Use a warm water bottle, rest, and stay hydrated. If pain stays severe, consult a doctor.
Detailed_Answer_English: For intense period pain, rest and use a warm compress on your lower abdomen. Avoid caffeine and drink plenty of water. Painkillers such as paracetamol can help if advised by a healthcare provider. If pain persists beyond 23 days or affects your routine, seek medical advice.
Source: Umeeda KB: Reproductive Health

Question_English: Is irregular period normal?
Question_RomanUrdu: Kya period ka ana band hona ya late hona normal hai?
Short_Answer_English: Slight changes are normal due to stress or diet, but long delays need a check-up.
Detailed_Answer_English: Period irregularity can happen because of stress, diet changes, exercise, or hormonal imbalance. Missing periods for more than two months without pregnancy should be checked by a doctor to rule out thyroid, PCOS, or other causes.
Source: Umeeda KB: Reproductive Health

Question_English: What does white discharge mean?
Question_RomanUrdu: White discharge ka matlab kya hota hai?
Short_Answer_English: Mild white discharge is normal; if it smells or causes itching, visit a doctor.
Detailed_Answer_English: White discharge before or after periods is natural and helps clean the vagina. If it becomes thick, yellow, green, or smells bad and causes itching or burning, it may be an infection that needs treatment.
Source: Umeeda KB: Reproductive Health

Question_English: Can I pray or fast during menstruation?
Question_RomanUrdu: Kya period ke dauran namaz ya roza rakha ja sakta hai?
Short_Answer_English: No, women are exempt from prayer and fasting during menstruation.
Detailed_Answer_English: According to Islamic teachings, women are not required to pray or fast during their menstruation days. Missed fasts can be made up later, but missed prayers are not required to be repeated. It is a time for rest and self-care.
Source: Islamic Teaching
Helpline: N/A

Question_English: How should I maintain hygiene during menstruation?
Question_RomanUrdu: Period ke dauran safai kaise rakhi jaye?
Short_Answer_English: Change pads regularly and wash properly with clean water.
Detailed_Answer_English: During menstruation, change sanitary pads every 46 hours to avoid infection. Wash the private area with clean water and dry it properly. Always dispose of pads properly and keep undergarments clean.
Source: Umeeda KB: Hygiene

Question_English: Why do I feel sad or angry during my period?
Question_RomanUrdu: Period ke dauran mujhe udaasi ya gussa kyu aata hai?
Short_Answer_English: Hormonal changes can cause mood swings.
Detailed_Answer_English: Hormonal changes during menstruation affect serotonin levels in the brain, leading to sadness, irritability, or fatigue. Light exercise, good sleep, and talking with someone you trust can help. If mood changes are very strong or persistent, consult a doctor.
Source: Umeeda KB: Emotional Health

Question_English: At what age do girls get their first period?
Question_RomanUrdu: Larkiyon ka pehla period kis umar mein aata hai?
Short_Answer_English: Usually between 1015 years, but it can vary.
Detailed_Answer_English: Most girls start menstruating between ages 10 and 15, depending on growth, genetics, and nutrition. Starting earlier or later can still be normal. If no period occurs by age 16, a doctors consultation is advised.
Source: Umeeda KB: Reproductive Health

Question_English: What if I get a stain at school or outside?
Question_RomanUrdu: Agar school mein ya bahar daag lag jaye to kya karun?
Short_Answer_English: Dont panic; cover with a sweater or bag and change pad as soon as possible.
Detailed_Answer_English: Period stains are normal and happen to everyone. Keep an extra pad and dark clothing in your bag. If stained, tie a sweater around the waist or ask a friend for help. Stay calm and change when possible.
Source: Umeeda KB: Hygiene

Question_English: How can I tell if my pain is serious?
Question_RomanUrdu: Kaise pata chale ke dard normal nahi hai?
Short_Answer_English: If pain stops daily work or causes vomiting, see a doctor.
Detailed_Answer_English: Severe pain with heavy bleeding, nausea, or fainting is not normal and could be a sign of a medical condition like endometriosis or PCOS. Seek medical advice immediately if pain becomes unbearable or unusual.
Source: Umeeda KB: Reproductive Health
